content.webTitle: Travelodge promises to cut room prices

fields.headline: Travelodge promises to cut room prices
fields.bodyText: Travelodge, the budget hotel chain, said it would introduce £20m of price cuts to "heap further pressure" on competitors. The company has pledged to sell 500,000 rooms at £26 and 100,000 at £10 next year and plans to add 2,750 rooms. The average room rate is expected to come down by 8%. It has merged two offices into one headquarters in Thame, Oxfordshire, saving £3m. The company is also reviewing the future of its reservations call centre, having switched 65% of its custom to the web. It says price rises by rivals make it "the only true" budget hotel chain in the UK.
